arts.ttl: Atalanta’s Gritti: “The team has reached important heights”
arts.sum: Tullio Gritti, who stepped in as head coach for Atalanta during Gian Piero Gasperini's suspension, celebrated a significant 2-0 victory over AS Roma at the Stadio Olimpico. The post Atalanta’s Gritti: “The team has reached important heights” appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Ranieri returns to Rome and Roma players show support for Bove on emotional night
arts.sum: On an emotional Serie A night in Rome, Claudio Ranieri returned to the Stadio Olimpico as the home coach and Edoardo Bove received an outpouring of support following his collapse . Roma lost to Napoli and fought back to draw at Tottenham 2-2 in the Europa League in the first two matches of his return.

arts.ttl: Roma Player Ratings vs Atalanta: Calamitous Giallorossi Humbled by Mighty Goddess
arts.sum: High-flying Atalanta poured more misery on out-of-sorts Roma, claiming a well-deserved 2-0 victory in Monday's titanic Serie A clash. The game proved one-sided at the Stadio Olimpico, with the home side struggling to get anything going, managing just one shot on target as they slumped to their sixth loss in the past seven rounds. The post Roma Player Ratings vs Atalanta: Calamitous Giallorossi Humbled by Mighty Goddess appeared first on The Cult of Calcio.

arts.ttl: Spalletti: ‘I haven’t spoken to Bove yet, but I wish him all the best’
arts.sum: Italian national team coach Luciano Spalletti attended the Gran Galà del Calcio event in Milan, where he shared his thoughts on various topics, including the health of Fiorentina’s Edoardo Bove and the state of Italian football. Reflecting on the significance of the event, Spalletti stated, “This is a beautiful evening that honors the quality of Italian football. Everyone who comes from abroad speaks of great difficulties regarding strategies and quality of play. They say our level is high.” Discussing the future of young players in Italy, he remarked, “There are many young talents showing their qualities, which are important for The post Spalletti: ‘I haven’t spoken to Bove yet, but I wish him all the best’ appeared first on FootItalia.com.
